reviewText: I am so glad to find this video. It is not easy to find this series videos. I enjoy the series as well as my children and my granddaughter.
I have been looking for this series and glad someone is selling them for others to enjoy again.
I looked for a while for tapes of this series and was so happy when the tape arrived works great.
i was happy to buy the shows on the vhs tape if it meant getting the shows from this series. I enjoyed it as well as my children did and now my granddaughter enjoys it as well.

This is a favorite for my toddler she can't get enough of the wishing bear. It is one of the best winnie the pooh's that I love watching it with my toddler to!!And so will you.

This is a must buy!!!!
Loved the movie. It is one of our kids favorites. They watch it again and again.

This tape, consisting of two episodes, "the wishing bear" and "the piglet who would be king" are excellent for children between the ages of 3 and 9. The stories are very appropriate and hearwarming.

The "wishing bear" is an episode where Christipher robin shows Pooh how to wish on a star while saying a rhyme. Pooh is frustrated because he forgets the rhyme. With the help of Rabbit and Tigger, Pooh is able to remember it. Pooh and his friends all make a wish on the star, and the star dissipears from the sky. Pooh thinks he has worn the star out, and therefore has to grant all his friends wishes. He also is afraid of dissapointing Christopher Robin, and dresses up like a star and hangs from a tree. Christipher knows it's Pooh.. and tells Pooh that he didn't wear the star out.

The second episode "The Piglet who would be King" starts with Pooh giving Piglet a friendship gift. Piglet didn't get anything for Pooh, and decided to travel to the land of milk and honey with rabbit and tigger in order to get Pooh a lot of honey for a gift. There, the little Piglys think Piglet is their King, and look up to him. In the end, Piglet must leave and returns to Pooh with a pot of honey.

Truly amazing stories! I still watch them today...

Disney animation is the best even if not a full feature. The saturday afternoon fare such as the Pooh series,Aladdin and others,
represent the Disney studios willingness to continue with what works best in animation and story. Not only great stories,but lessons to be learned as well."The Piglet Who Would Be King" is a perfect example. Being able to watch these with your kids is a joy.

Ep. 11: Gone with the Wind/Nothing But the Tooth
Ep. 10: How Much is That Rabbit in the Window?

Highly recommend this for die hard Winnie the Pooh fans.

Ep. 4: Find Her, Keep Her

I remember having this back then, but I lost it for unknown reasons. But I still recommend it for the fans and children.

I recommend this for the fans. This is the only vol. in the series that I have.

Highly recommend this for fans who love this show since they were kids.
Purchased as a gift as she collects Disney films especially on VHS.  She has a big collection of the Disney films but I think this one was the last on her list.
Got this for my daughter, long-held childhood memory!  She loved the show as a child and loved the video.  Thanks.

The New Adventures of Winnie the Pooh was a cartoon series that premiered in 1988 on The Disney Channel. 13 episodes aired before the show moved to ABC in the fall of 1988. Each episode was either a full length story that covered the entire episode, or two short stories that filled the episode. Season 1 had 22 episodes, Season 2 had 10 episodes, Season 3 had 10 episodes and Season 4 had 8 episodes, totaling 50 episodes and concluding in 1991. The series was then followed by a number of specials. In order, these were Winnie the Pooh and Christmas Too in 1991, Boo To You! Winnie the Pooh in 1996, A Winnie the Pooh Thanksgiving in 1998, Winnie the Pooh: A Valentine for You in 1999 and Winnie the Pooh; A Very Merry Pooh Year in 2002. As of 2012, Disney has yet to release the show as a complete series. The majority of episodes have however been released in various collections over the years. The only episodes not to be released in the US on any home media format are- Pooh Oughta Be in Pictures (the very first episode- this is available on the UK VHS video Hundred Acre Hero at Amazon.co.uk) Cleanliness Is Next to Impossible (episode 6- this is available on the UK VHS Bubbles and Troubles at Amazon.co.uk) To Be or Not To Bee (episode 38.1- not available on any home media format in the world) Sorry Wrong Slusher (episode 43- not available on any home media format in the world) The rest of the series has been released either on DVD or VHS. Now as to this specific The New Adventures of Winnie the Pooh: Wind Some Lose Some VHS video. This is Volume 5 in The New Adventures of Winnie the Pooh VHS collection. The next volume in the collection is Winnie the Pooh: All's Well That Ends Well [VHS]. The previous volume in the collection is Theres No Camp Like Home [VHS]. Episodes include: Gone With the Wind (Episode 11-1) (Also available on the VHS video Winnie the Pooh: Clever Little Piglet [VHS]) Nothing But the Tooth (Episode 11-2) (Also available on the VHS video Winnie the Pooh: Clever Little Piglet [VHS]) How Much is That Rabbit in the Window (Episode 10)

Each episode was either a full length story that covered the entire episode, or two short stories that filled the episode. The series was then followed by a number of specials. In order, these were Winnie the Pooh and Christmas Too in 1991, Boo To You! Winnie the Pooh in 1996, A Winnie the Pooh Thanksgiving in 1998, Winnie the Pooh: A Valentine for You in 1999 and Winnie the Pooh; A Very Merry Pooh Year in 2002. As of 2012, Disney has yet to release the show as a complete series. The majority of episodes have however been released in various collections over the years. Now as to this specific The New Adventures of Winnie the Pooh: Newfound Friends VHS video. This is Volume 3 in The New Adventures of Winnie the Pooh VHS collection. The next volume in the collection is Theres No Camp Like Home [VHS]. The previous volume in the collection is The New Adventures of Winnie the Pooh, Vol. 2: The Wishing Bear [VHS]. Episodes include: Find Her, Keep Her (Episode 4) (Also available on the UK VHS video Birds of a Feather and as part of the DVD Buena Vista Winnie The Pooh-seasons Of Giving-10th Ann [back To Back][dvd/ff 1.33/sp-fr in which the story continues) Donkey for a Day (Episode 2-2) (Also available on the DVD Disney's Growing up with Winnie the Pooh All for One, One for All: Adventures in Sharing and Caring and the UK DVD Magical World of Winnie the Pooh Volume 1 - All for One, One for All) Friend, in Deed (Episode 2-1) (Also available on the DVD Disney's Growing up with Winnie the Pooh All for One, One for All: Adventures in Sharing and Caring and the UK DVD Magical World of Winnie the Pooh Volume 1 - All for One, One for All)

Season 1 had 22 episodes, Season 2 had 10 episodes, Season 3 had 10 episodes and Season 4 had 8 episodes, totaling 50 episodes and concluding in 1991. The series was then followed by a number of specials. In order, these were Winnie the Pooh and Christmas Too in 1991, Boo To You! Winnie the Pooh in 1996, A Winnie the Pooh Thanksgiving in 1998, Winnie the Pooh: A Valentine for You in 1999 and Winnie the Pooh; A Very Merry Pooh Year in 2002. As of 2012, Disney has yet to release the show as a complete series. The majority of episodes have however been released in various collections over the years. Episodes include: The Great Honey Pot Robbery (Episode 7) Stripes (Episode 8-1) (Also available on the VHS Winnie the Pooh: Tigger-Ific Tales [VHS], the DVD Growing Up with Winnie the Pooh - Love and Friendship and the UK DVD Magical World of Winnie the Pooh Volume 6 - Love And Friendship) Monkey See, Money Do Better (Episode 8-2) (Also available on the UK DVD Magical World of Winnie the Pooh Volume 2 - Little Things Mean A Lot)

More of the wonderful adventures of 100 Acre Wood friends. Perfect for any small child.
I would like to purchase this classic series as soon as it becomes available.
This was one of the finest programs on television. So glad to see these old friends again :)

The Wishing Bear is one of the best episodes of the series. The story, the message, and the very touching ending will have you in tears every time. A must watch for fans.
Disney at its best.

I was so happy to find this.  It was a present for my little boy who's big, to give to his new one when he comes.  This was the most touching of all the Winnie the Pooh adventures, (How much is that rabbit in the window?)  Amazing it's still available, too, only through Amazon!!
